title: Ensuring Access to Nutritious Food — C.R.O.P.S.
text_content: Ensuring Access to Nutritious Food — C.R.O.P.S. 0 Skip to Content About Programs Cultivating Fresh Produce Ensuring Access to Nutritious Food Farm Share Program Educational Programming Advocacy Press Events Contact Shop DONATE Open Menu Close Menu About Programs Cultivating Fresh Produce Ensuring Access to Nutritious Food Farm Share Program Educational Programming Advocacy Press Events Contact Shop DONATE Open Menu Close Menu About Folder: Programs Back Cultivating Fresh Produce Ensuring Access to Nutritious Food Farm Share Program Educational Programming Advocacy Press Events Contact Shop DONATE Ensuring Access to Nutritious Food Farmers Markets Our farmers markets are inclusive and welcoming, with locally grown vegetables, fruit and herbs available for sale using a variety of payment methods including Food Benefits (SNAP/EBT, Good Food Bucks, WIC, & SFMNP). You’ll not only go home with nutritious and delicious produce, but also meet your neighbors, the farmers who grow your food, and take home additional items like recipes. 2025 Fisherman’s Park Community Garden Farmers Market Dates*: Fridays, June 20th - September 19thTime: 4-6pmPayment types: cash, credit, debit, SNAP/EBT, Good Food Bucks, WIC, SFMNP, Venmo, PRxLocation: Fisherman’s Park, @Massachusetts Ave & Drexel Ave, in Atlantic CityOn select dates, C.R.O.P.S. will be joined by the Community Food Bank of NJ for SNAP Outreach.*No Farmers Market Friday, July 4th. Farm Share ProgramShareholders in this Program sign up for a series of pre-paid boxes, aka “shares,” of produce grown by South Jersey farmers, available for pickup in Atlantic City.This Program exists to make fresh, local food available in Atlantic City communities and support our farm partners. The cost per box uses a sliding scale based on household income and size. Our shareholders all receive the same share regardless of payment type or financial resources because everyone deserves nutritious food! learn more & sign up The Food Hub In the Food Hub, our Team aggregates produce grown by small to mid-sized farms in South Jersey so that it stays fresh and is quickly available to consumers in Atlantic City. You can find the Food Hub at 167 S. Tennessee Ave, Atlantic City NJ, in the Orange Loop of the City. We’ve installed 10 refrigerators at the Food Hub, where local produce is kept fresh before going to our Farmers Markets or into Farm Share boxes. In the past year, $9,000+ of produce moved through the Food Hub, increasing access to nutritious food in our community. C.R.O.P.S.’s Refrigeration Program installs refrigerators at partner organizations & corner stores in Atlantic City. Oceanside II Family Success Center, Atlantic City Installation day! Pacific Market, Atlantic City Installation day! Cedar Basic Food, Atlantic City Installation day! Oceanside II Fresh produce, such as this lettuce grown by farmer participants in C.R.O.P.S.’s UCAN Farmer Training Program in hydroponics systems at Farmers Row, is available for Oceanside II’s program participants to take home. Pacific Market Fresh produce grown by South Jersey farmers & Atlantic City UCAN farmer participants is available for purchase. Cedar Basic Food Fresh produce grown by South Jersey farmers & Atlantic City UCAN farmer participants will be available for purchase soon. Donate Subscribe to the C.R.O.P.S. title: Go Green Galloway – Township of Galloway Green Team
text_content: Go Green Galloway – Township of Galloway Green Team Go Green Galloway Township of Galloway Green Team Menu Skip to content All about us! Get Involved GALLOWAY GREEN MARKET Committees “Friends Along the Mullica” Invasive Plants Links All about us! About Go Green Galloway Go Green Galloway is a group of dedicated volunteers committed to educating our community on living a more sustainable life.  Our members each bring their own passions to the group – native plant gardening, energy conservation, wildlife habitats, litter reduction, reducing plastics – these are just a few areas of focus. We always welcome new members and invite you to attend a meeting or two to get to know us.  You can also join our email list and, of course, follow us on FaceBook!  See the “Get Involved” page for more information. If you missed one of webinars – we have them saved on YouTube for you to enjoy!: Friends Along the Mullica – https://youtu.be/9jh4P8NpBo4 A Plastic Ocean -movie screening/discussion: https://youtu.be/dZXs8arSsTo An Evening with Doug Tallamy: https://youtu.be/Lnndy3bO3UE Find us on FACEBOOK Find us on FACEBOOK Website Powered by WordPress.com. COMMUNITY / River Edge Farmers Market River Edge Farmers Market The River Edge Farmers Market brings the best of New Jersey Farms to you!The mission of our Farmers Market is to:Provide healthy fresh produceProvide a sense of communityImprove local food securitySupport the entrepreneurial efforts of local businessesSupport local farmersBuy your fresh produce every Thursday all summer at the River Edge Farmers Market.Our Vendors: River Edge Farmers Market is thrilled to have Springhouse Farms joining us with their extensive selection of farm fresh fruits and vegetables!The Ice Cream Lady of New Jersey serves Northern Bergen County year round.With over 55 varieties there's always something for everybody.Kosher, Dairy-Free, Nut-Free, Gluten-Free options available.You can order any beer you want on-line by 12 noon Thursday from Hackensack Brewing and pick it up that day at the Farmers Market.Jersey Pickles offers a variety of delicious pickles and olives.The Empanada Lady serves many kinds of delectable empanadas (a fried turnover with assorted meat and vegetable fillings). Uncle Bob's Kettle Corn is a family-owned company based in Hillsdale, New Jersey that offers high quality gourmet kettle corn in all the flavors you're cravin'!Eat My Balls NJ offers gourmet Sicilian Arancini- authentic rice balls.George Barnes' Organic River Edge Honey will be joining us for 10 weeks.  Schedule to come.Saya Bakery offers many delicious fresh baked breads and pastriesJerky Rob offers a fantastic array of beef, bacon, vegan and fish jerky as well as hot sauce.Groomington Eats offers many healthy, delicious dog treats.Garden State Girl Designs makes gorgeous jewelry out of flowers. title: ABOUT | Columbus Market
text_content: ABOUT | Columbus Market top of page TESTIMONIALSHOMEMARKET & SHOPSFLOOR PLAN INSIDE STORESPHONE LIST OF INDOOR MERCHANTSOUTDOOR FLEA MARKETPRODUCE ROWAMISH MARKETGREENTOP GARDENCENTRAL JERSEY EQUIPMENTTOMMY'S PALLETSAMERICAN SHEDSCOLUMBUS SELF-STORAGEHOURS & DIRECTIONSMARKET HOURSDIRECTIONS & MAPSFARMERS MARKET COMPLEX MAPPARKING INFORMATION & BUSESPROSPECTIVE VENDORSHOW TO BECOME A FLEA MARKET VENDOROUTSIDE FOOD VENDINGLEASE AN INSIDE STOREJOB APPLICATIONSCONTACTCFM Authentic Products PolicingMoreUse tab to navigate through the menu items.Welcome to the Columbus Farmers Market!  Operating since1929, The Columbus Farmers Market is proud to be the Delaware Valley's oldest and largest Flea Market!  Each week brings new vendors & shoppers!   We are conveniently located on Route 206 South in Columbus, New Jersey, just minutes from the NJ Turnpike & Route 295. You will find just about anything!  Fresh produce and seafood, excellent meats, delicious baked goods.  Household and decorative items, clothing and accessories.  Outdoor Flea Market with new and used merchandise.  Many great food vendors.  Flowers, plants and garden ornaments. American Sheds has an outstanding selection of sheds.  Store it all at our state-of-the-art Self Storage facility.  Stop by Central Jersey Equipment for the best in John Deere products.Columbus is a fun for all flea market. Try it you will love it. There are many ways you can use this flea market. You can use it for a fun day out with plenty to eat and look at. Or it is a great place to get rid of unwanted items without a bunch of people into your house. ​ George M. Philadelphia, PA (YELP)The new renovation is fantastic. There are a good amount of seats and the food is delicious. What a great addition to the already awesome Columbus Market! I have been going to the Market since 1983 and it was the same until they added new stores and now the food court. There are always lines for the bathrooms, but this last visit was the cleanest I have seen the ladies room. ﻿​ Sharon B. title: Farmers Market
text_content: Farmers Market Rancocas Woods Events & ShopsRancocas Woods Events & ShopsRancocas Woods Events & ShopsRancocas Woods Events & ShopsSign InMy AccountSigned in as:filler@godaddy.comMy AccountSign outHomeEventsShopsFarmers MarketRW Business AssociationPassport to NatureCommunity GardenFAQ // Contact UsMoreHomeEventsShopsFarmers MarketRW Business AssociationPassport to NatureCommunity GardenFAQ // Contact UsRancocas Woods Events & ShopsRancocas Woods Events & ShopsRancocas Woods Events & ShopsRancocas Woods Events & ShopsSigned in as:filler@godaddy.comHomeEventsShopsFarmers MarketRW Business AssociationPassport to NatureCommunity GardenFAQ // Contact UsAccountMy AccountSign outSign InMy Account Rancocas Woods Farmers MarketEvery Sunday, June 1 - Oct 26, 202510am - 2pm, RAIN OR SHINE*Some extended hours*Farmers Market Vendors can sign up using: www.managemymarket.comInterested musicians + potential sponsors contact: rancocaswoodsfm@gmail.com Volunteer application form:https://forms.gle/gMjb5aepViFWMSE48Connect with us on Facebook ! Come Spend Your Sunday in The Woods! Our MissionTo support & promote an economically sustainable, localized food system & business network in Mount Laurel. It is our intention to contribute to a thriving community in which growers, producers, artisans & neighbors mutually support one another by offering a location for locally-made products to be purchased. Farmers Market FAQWhen Does the Market Start?The market begins June 1, 2025 and ends October 26, 2026. It is every Sunday from 10 AM - 2 PM with extended hours for special events. Where is the Market Located?The market is located in the Rancocas Woods Village of Shops on Creek Road in Mount Laurel, NJ. It takes place off Conestoga Lane, behind our stage and courtyard adjacent to where our hot dog stand, “The Shack”, meets Creek Road.   The Shack is a small red schoolhouse-type building on the corner of Conestoga Lane and Creek Road and is located at 120 Creek Road, Mount Laurel, NJ 08054. What Happens if it Rains?We are a rain or shine event.  It is rare that a farmers market is completely canceled. HOWEVER, in the case of severe weather we may cancel the market. It will be announced by 7AM if the market will be closed for the day.   If we ever have lightning in the middle of a market day, the market needs to close down. We may call for a rain delay or close early in this instance.  Expect to be out in the rain unless it's a thunderstorm. A tropical storm or hurricane remnants is also a case for severe weather where it may be wise to close completely for everyone's safety.   Again, we will let all vendors know by 7AM and announce this on our social media platforms if the market will be closed. Can I Bring a Pet to the Market?Yes, well-behaved animals are more than welcome to join us. You must clean up after your pet. If your animal is not well-behaved or you fail to clean up after your pet, your pet will be banned from the market. Be mindful, there will be live music! Do you Take SNAP/EBT?Yes!Is There Live Music?We do have live music at our highlight events with extended hours. We are always looking for volunteer musicians to share their talents with us during our weekly markets. Interested musicians should email rancocaswoodsfm@gmail.comWhen and Where is Yoga Located?Yoga is across the street from the vendors, on the other side of Conestoga Lane, behind the community garden. It starts at 10 AM. There is no yoga on dates with extended hours.When and Where are Workshops Located?Workshops are located in the same place yoga is. It is across the street from the vendors, on the other side of Conestoga Lane, behind the community garden. They start at 12 PM. What Amenities are Available?Amenities on and near the property include restaurants, hiking trails, outdoor seating, and restrooms. Hiking trails can be accessed off Rancocas Blvd on our side of Rancocas State Park. Who Can be a Vendor? How Do I Apply to Become a Vendor?We are open to a myriad of vendors. We try to only accept vendors within a 60 mile radius of the market. We host farmers, bakers, cooks, crafters, nonprofits, and niche agricultural vendors. We are always looking for unique, environmentally conscious vendors, so don’t hesitate to reach out to apply. Farmers Market Vendors can sign up using: www.managemymarket.comCan Nonprofit Vendors Ask for Donations?Yes, nonprofits can ask for donations with approval. Any unapproved solicitation of funds will result in removal from the market. What About Political Affiliations?No candidates or person may use the market for political gain. No political activities will be allowed at the market. City Green's Good Food Bucks ProgramNew Jersey's largest statewide SNAP-Doubling nutrition incentive program for fruits and vegetables at farmers markets, grocery stores, and other fresh-food retailers. For every $1 you spend with your SNAP Families First EBT Card at participating locations, you receive a Good Food Bucks coupon or discount for yo

title: Collingswood Farmers' Market - Collingswood Farmers' Market
text_content: Collingswood Farmers' Market - Collingswood Farmers' Market Home farms + vendors vendor directory looking for space? about history + location payment options dog policy Events Support The Market Volunteer sponsorships Contact Home farms + vendors vendor directory looking for space? about history + location payment options dog policy Events Support The Market Volunteer sponsorships Contact Join us for our next market:​SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 20TH PDF Market map: 9/20 get our weekly market preview emails! Since May 2000, the Collingswood Farmers Market has helped bring local, fresh, nutritionally dense food to our community while helping to keep farmers farming. What started as a small market with 12 farms has grown into a regular part of the Saturday mornings of the residents of Collingswood and so many surrounding townsn.Our list of farmers and vendors has grown exponentially, allowing market-goers to buy everything from produce to meat to flowers and everything in between - all while sipping a fresh, hot cup of coffee from local coffee roasters, grabbing breakfast made with fresh, local ingredients and enjoying live music from local musicians.There are few things better than knowing the people who grow the foods you're consuming. While shopping at our market, you can be confident in the fact that you're improving the quality of the foods you eat, preserving our environment and supporting your local economy. From the first Saturday in May through the Saturday before Thanksgiving, we're outside underneath the Patco High Speedline between Collings and Irvin Ave, rain or shine from 8:00am until noon. Find the big blue water towers, you'll find the market! THANKS TO OUR A-MAIZE-ING 2025 SPONSORS! title: Downtown Farmers Market | DOOWW
text_content: Downtown Farmers Market | DOOWW top of pageTHINGS TO DOFarmers Market Music in the Plaza Family Movies Tram Car Fitness Fireworks HomeDowntown WildwoodFree Family MoviesFitness in the PlazaDowntown Farmers MarketMusic in the PlazaByrne Plaza Live CamWildwoods BoardwalkFriday Night FireworksTram Car InfoShopDineStayPlayContactAboutCareersGalleryDowntown ImagesBoardwalk ImagesNPPResource Center2025 Byrne Plaza Events BrochureJitney ScheduleLive CamBoardwalk Events PosterFarmers Market Vendor ApplicationByrne Plaza Use ApplicationByrne Plaza Event PosterUEZ ProgramMoreUse tab to navigate through the menu items.Every Saturday8:00am-12:30pmFarmers Market2025 Market Information and Vendor Application Memorial Day Weekend 2025 will kick off Season #12 of the Downtown Wildwood Farmers Market! Conveniently located 2 blocks off the Boardwalk, the Downtown Wildwood Farmers Market is held at Byrne Plaza and beyond (3400 to 3501 Pacific Avenue), from 8 am to 12:30 pm, every Saturday morning from Memorial Day weekend to Labor Day weekend. With a roster of over 100 vendors, our 70+ weekly vendor variety changes each week! We have farmers with the freshest produce, honey, eggs & beautiful flowers, amazing bakers offering bread, cookies, cakes, sticky buns, donuts and more as well as lots of gluten free offerings! Our specialty food makers sell pickles, jerky, chocolate covered fruit, salsa, hot sauce, granola, oils & vinegars, seasonings, sea salts, and so much more! ​ You will find drinks & food to enjoy while you shop, as well as wine, craft beer & spirits, heat & eat meals and crab cakes, as well as seafood steam pots to take home! You will find guacamole and lemonade made to order as well as sandwiches, soft pretzels, assorted snacks and coffee! ​ In addition to our food vendors, we have a large assortment of crafters selling handmade soaps, lotions, candles, jewelry, sea glass art, clothing, photos, bags, headbands, home goods, assorted art work and more. Bring your well behaved dogs and visit our many pet goods vendors selling homemade treats and unique accessories! GalleryThe Downtown Wildwood Farmers Market is so much more than a Farmers Market! It’s an open air gift shop of handmade items including candles and soaps, jewelry, dog collars and dog treats, personalized glasses and gifts, engraved insulated tumblers, masks and more! You can find boutique clothing, as well as surf shop gear for all your family and friends! There will be several artists selling their oil paintings, watercolors, wood signs, authentic neon signs, chimes, sea glass items and lots of other items. The variety is great, offering one stop shopping! Each week there will be a children’s entertainer offering balloon twirling or face/arm painting and the like! There is truly something for everyone at the Downtown Wildwood Farmers Market! Be sure to stop by the DOOWW information booth to pick up your free DOOWW Magnet, Byrne Plaza Schedule of Events and information about all the great things happening in Downtown Wildwood! While you’re picking up the freebies, you can also purchase DOOWW Christmas Ornaments, Tee shirts and Sweatshirts, all at the DOOWW Information booth located at the Pacific and Oak Avenue entrance to Byrne Plaza! Parking is always Free for Byrne Plaza Events in the parking lots behind the shops; on the east side of Pacific Avenue, between Oak and Schellenger Avenues, and on the west side of Pacific, between Oak and Wildwood Avenues.Vendors?ApplicationPlease email questions to Joanne.boardwalk@gmail.com or call 609-523-1602. Thank you for your interest in the Downtown Wildwood Farmers Market!ContactTel: 609-523-1602 Wildwood Boardwalk New Jersey, USANavigationEvents Careers About ContactSocialFacebook Instagram Youtube Tik Tok XFind Us On© 2025 DOOWW. title: The Montclair Farmers' Market
text_content: The Montclair Farmers' Market 0 Skip to Content Home About Us Vendors Programs FAQ Calendar Contact Open Menu Close Menu Home About Us Vendors Programs FAQ Calendar Contact Open Menu Close Menu Home About Us Vendors Programs FAQ Calendar Contact EVERY SATURDAY AT THE WALNUT STREET train STATION86 Walnut Street, Montclair, NJ 07042 OUR ROOTSMontclair was one of the very first towns in the Garden State to host a farmers’ market back in 1993. Since then, the health, economic, and environmental benefits of farmers’ markets have enticed other towns and cities to follow our lead. The Montclair Farmers’ Market is now a community gathering spot for thousands of local residents and visitors each year. Learn more OUR VENDORSThe Montclair Farmers’ Market brings you an array of local farmers and food artisans, offering fresh fruits & vegetables, meats, poultry, fish, cheeses, prepared foods, baked goods, condiments, honey, flowers, wine, pickles, and so much more. Visit our vendor page for a current list of knowledgable and inviting vendors who are ready to serve you. We empower people to take charge of their well-being by providing health and wellness education and access to nutritious foods. This is just one of the ways we have a positive social impact on our community. Planting Roots in the Community The Beth Greenhouse, located at the corner of Osborne Terrace and Lehigh Avenue at Newark Beth Israel Medical Center, is a sustainable, hydroponic greenhouse that produces more than 5,000 pounds of high quality, nutritious, locally grown lettuce, herbs and greens to the Newark area each year. The Beth Greenhouse provides access to healthy foods and nutrition and wellness education throughout the year. The produce grown in the Greenhouse supplies our seasonal, weekly Farmers Market, food pantry programs and community partner organizations. The greenhouse offers the ultimate farm-to-table experience through year-round field trips, which offers healthy food and nutrition education for groups of all ages including schools, scouts, seniors and more. The Greenhouse supports health and wellness activities at the Rev. Dr. Ronald B. Christian Community Health and Wellness Center, and serves as an intergenerational education hub where a diverse community can participate in gardening activities, exchange recipes, obtain plant starts for their home gardens and learn about the importance of good nutrition. Download Flyer (PDF) For more information about visiting the Greenhouse, contact Molly Fallon at 973-926-7371 or Molly.Fallon@rwjbh.org, or Barbara Mintz at Barbara.Mintz@rwjbh.org. The Beth Greenhouse Farmers Market The Beth Greenhouse Farmers Market offers nutritious, affordable vegetables for sale to the Newark community. The market features greens and herbs grown right at the Beth Greenhouse as well as locally grown produce from New Jersey’s rural and urban farmers. It is located near the Osborne Terrace entrance to the Newark Strong Lobby at Newark Beth Israel Medical Center. We are an environmentally friendly market – please bring your own bag! Open from June through November on Thursdays from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Accepts, SNAP, WIC and Senior Farmers Market Nutrition Program benefits Participates in City Green’s Good Food Bucks, allowing SNAP users to pay only 50 percent of their bill Greenhouse Field Trips Students will gain hands-on experience in our hydroponic greenhouse learning to plant seeds, transplant seedlings and harvest fresh veggies to take home and share with their family. Field trips include a greenhouse tour, hands-on farming experience and recipe testing using fresh ingredients from the Greenhouse. Greenhouse field trips include: Year-round trips for grades K-12, scouts, seniors, community groups and more Hands-on hydroponic experience Plant seeds, transplant and harvest fruits and vegetables Healthy recipe making and tasting Download Flyer (PDF) To schedule a field trip, contact Molly Fallon at 973-926-7371 or Molly.Fallon@rwjbh.org. What is Hydroponic Farming? Hydroponic farming is a highly productive, environmentally friendly, and space-efficient means of growing food. It uses mineral nutrient solutions that are delivered to the plants via water, eliminating the need for soil

title: Greater Newark Conservancy | Food Resources in Newark | Newark, NJ
text_content: Greater Newark Conservancy | Food Resources in Newark | Newark, NJ About Our Roots Meet Our Team Financials Programs Education Urban Agriculture CHFiNS Get Involved Donate Volunteer Rent Our Space Job Opportunities Events Contact Food Education for a Healthier Community Greater Newark Conservancy All ProgramsFostering Collaboration in Our Newark Community VolunteerMake A DonationAccess To Green Spaces, Nutritious Food, Wellness Education, and  Youth Development Events Upcoming Events for Access toNutritious Food and Wellness EducationOur programs emphasize nutrition education, providing individuals and families with the knowledge they need to make informed, healthier choices. We collaborate with local farmers and organize community farmers markets to make fresh, sustainable food readily available to all. Get involved in our upcoming events and see what Greater Newark Conservancy has to offer for our amazing Newark community.View Upcoming Events Farewell to Hawthorne Avenue Farm Farewell to Hawthorne Avenue Farm Volunteer with Greater Newark Conservancy Volunteers are a vital part of Greater Newark Conservancy’s mission. Through the power of community involvement, we cultivate a space where food and wellness education come together, promoting better health for everyone. Volunteer Opportunities Our mission goes beyond simply addressing food access—we are dedicated to fostering holistic wellness through our wellness education programs.These initiatives are designed to help all individuals develop lifelong, healthy habits. By engaging with the community, we provide essential tools and resources that empower families to thrive, focusing on the connection between food education and overall well-being.About Us Our programs highlight the importance of nutrition, healthy cooking, and mindful eating as key components of health.Through partnerships with local farmers, we host community farmers markets that not only provide fresh, sustainable food but also serve as hubs for learning and connection. These markets are vital in bridging the gap between local producers and community members, ensuring access to affordable, nutritious food. Our Programs Let’s make healthy choices accessible byEmpowering Wellness TogetherWe believe that health and wellness should be accessible to everyone, and our community-focused approach brings this vision to life. By working together, we create spaces where individuals can explore how food impacts health, engage in wellness practices, and learn sustainable, healthy lifestyle habits. Learn More Join Us in Supporting Local Farmers and Participating in Farmers Markets Near YouTogether, we can make wellness education and access to fresh, nutritious food a reality for all, promoting a stronger, healthier community. title: Township of Nutley New Jersey - Nutley Farmers Market
text_content: Township of Nutley New Jersey - Nutley Farmers Market Departments Business Residents Government Recreation Forms Residents / Community Events and Programs / Nutley Farmers Market Nutley Farmers Market Participating Vendors • Entertainment Schedule • Market Walk and TalkFood Pantry Donations • Senior Farmers Market VouchersNutley Farmers Market News & Happenings!       SUMMER 2025 FARMERS MARKET INFORMATIONSundays - June 15 - October 269:00am - 2:00pmAlong Booth DriveNOW ACCEPTING VENDORS FOR SUMMER 2025 MARKETEmail our Market Managers at farmersmarket@nutleynj.org to learn how to participate in our 1th Market Season!Follow us on  Facebook  ,  Twitter  , and  Instagram  and subscribe to our weekly email  so you don’t miss a thing!   The Nutley Farmers Market, established in 2009, features live musical entertainment and a wide variety of fresh regionally-grown produce, as well as cut flowers, homemade cheese, dried fruit and fresh nuts, pickles, bread and more.  The market helps New Jersey family farmers; enables people to meet, talk to and ask questions of the person who grew their food; brings shoppers into our local business districts; and is a great place to meet friends and neighbors.The Market runs Sundays from mid-June through October of each season and takes place in Downtown Nutley along Booth Drive, from 9am to 2pm. Questions? Interested in becoming a vendor, musical guest or Walk & Talk Leader? Contact Co-Market Manager Meredith Blank at farmersmarket@nutleynj.org or 973-284-4978.The Nutley Farmers Market is sponsored by Commissioner Joseph P. Scarpelli, Director of Public Works and the Greenutley Committee. Entertainment is provided from 10am - 1pm. Picnic tables are provided for patrons to relax and listen to sounds while also catching up with friends and neighbors.If you or your musical group would like to perform at the market, please email our market managers.2025 Entertainment ScheduleTO BE ANNOUNCED Market Walk and TalkNutley Farmers Market Walk & Talk helps Market patrons get fit AND informed during their weekly visit to the Market.Every Sunday during the Market season, walkers can join a featured leader for a 3-mile scenic loop. During the walk, participants can ask the leader questions within their area of expertise in a relaxed, informal setting. Walkers meet at the Nutley Farmers Market at 8:15am, step off at 8:30am, and return to the Market to stock up for the week ahead.Market Walk & Talk leaders come from a wide variety of disciplines, including health, wellness, fitness, education, government, law, art, design, writing, and more.Market Walk & Talk is funded in part by a grant to the Nutley Department of Health from Partners for Health Foundation whose mission is to make our communities healthier, better places to live.Special Events at the MarketSpecial events take place throughout the season such as demonstrations, contests, book signings, art-making, and outreach days with community organizations and school groups. Sponsored by the Department of Public Works, special recycling days focus on items that aren't picked up during our regular curbside collection.Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and subscribe to our weekly email so you don’t miss a thing! text_content: Home | The Woman's Club of Wenonah top of pageHomeHistoryJoinFarmers MarketInfoWho We AreMap of Vendors2025 Market Sponsors2025 Market ApplicationSponsorshipSponsorship FormVolunteer Sign UpBook LoversBlogEventsMoreUse tab to navigate through the menu items.womansclubofwenonah@gmail.comThe Woman's Club of WenonahCommunity. Curiosity. Caring.Home: WelcomeThe Woman's Club of Wenonah at a GlanceA Distinct IdentityThe Woman's Club of Wenonah knows that our strength lies not only in the words we stand by but, most importantly, through the actions of our initiatives. ​ Our club is focused on empowering women through teamwork, kindness, and experience! We believe members should participate in a way that makes sense with their lifestyles. ​ If you are interested in making a difference in our community and becoming part of a group of women who empower each other, please join us today! We need your unique talents and skills! ​ Regular meetings are held on the 2nd Monday of the month, September - May. See below for more activities and information on our programs! Some of our projects include: MLK Day of Service Spring Library Book Sale Plant Sale School Awards - 6th Grade Awards Girls Career Institute Elementary School Writing Contest Wenonah Farmers Market Annual Friendship Dinner Turkey Trot Holiday Toy Drive Luminary Project Evening with the Madrigals Holiday Caroling in Wenonah 12th Night Celebration Participating in the Special State Project – Emmanuel Cancer Foundation Book Lovers Affair book club Spring Flower Delivery County Animal Shelter Food Drive ​Our ProjectsWenonah Farmers Market Thursdays 4-7 pm May-SeptemberHelping The CommunityFood Donation Drop-Off & PrepReinforcing our CommitmentHoliday Luminaries December 24Lighting up our Town"No one can make you feel inferior without your consent."Eleanor RooseveltMembership Porch PartyGetting to Know UsMake A Wish YardsaleHelping OthersThe MadrigalsCelebrating the Holidays with Song"Throughout this pandemic I was inspired by all of you who gave your time and talents to bring the Farmers Market to our community (and beyond) in a time where social isolation and the need for human contact was taking its toll on most of us. Each week I was thankful to have somewhere local to go to get healthy and yummy foods, safely see neighbors and friends, and just simply get out of my house! I want to thank you all for what you did for me."-Michelle C. "We settled on our first home on Christmas Eve and ended up spending Christmas night on an air mattress with our baby and dog. When we pulled onto Mantua Ave., we saw the luminaries lighting our way. My husband and I both welled up because of how perfect and surreal that welcome was. We will never forget that moment ... and you did that! I want to be part of something like that. Something that gives people that special feeling and does good while lifting one another up!" -Valentina F. ​MLK Day ProjectsHonoring a LegacyHoliday DecoratingPartnering with the CommunityCollege ScholarshipEncouraging LearningOur Meetings & Programs for 2024/2025Our programs are held on the 2nd Monday of the month from September - May. Attendance is not required.2024-2025 Program Year Monday, January 6, 2025 7-7:30 pm Neighborhood Networking 7:30-8:30 WCW Business Meeting and Featured Program ​​Drew Davis - Gem Life ​ Monday, February 10, 2025 7-7:30 pm Neighborhood Networking 7:30-8:30 WCW Business Meeting and Featured Program ​Kathy Peek - Disaster Preparedness ​ Monday, March 10, 2025 7-7:30 pm Neighborhood Networking 7:30-8:30 WCW Business Meeting and Featured Program ​Writing Contest Winners ​ Monday, April 14, 2025 7-7:30 pm Neighborhood Networking 7:30-8:30 WCW Business Meeting and Featured Program ​Joan Tice ​ Monday, May 12, 2025 7-7:30 pm Neighborhood Networking 7:30-8:30 WCW Business Meeting and Featured Program ​New Officer Installation ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​​​ ​ ​​​​​​​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​Book Lover's Affair is held on the 4th Monday of the month throughout the year. Discussions are open to the public! The History of our Collect written by Mary Stuart, 1904Mary Stewart wrote the Collect in 1904 as a member of the Fortnightly Club, the forerunner of the Longmont Colorado BPW club. The Collect was written as a prayer to instill a sense of unity among women working together with wide interests and important goals. Mary Stewart worked for women's suffrage nationally and attended the meeting in St. Louis, where the National Federation was launched. She was elected its first corresponding secretary and thereafter took an active part in the growth of the young organization by service as chairman or member of a number of national committees. In her words we can learn to strive to always be better "Keep us, O God, from pettiness; let us be large in thought, in word, in deed. Let us be done with fault-finding and leave off self-seeking. May we put away all pretense and meet each other face to face -- without self-pity and without prejudice. May we never be hasty in judg

title: Farmer’s Market – Main Street Woodbury Inc.
text_content: Farmer’s Market – Main Street Woodbury Inc. Skip to content Skip to content Home The Board Volunteer Ghost Tour Farmer’s Market Store Contact Home The Board Volunteer Ghost Tour Farmer’s Market Store Contact Facebook-f Linkedin Twitter Farmer’s Market The Woodbury Farmers Market is sponsored by Main Street Woodbury, Inc. and supported by a dedicated team of volunteers, along with the generous contributions of our donors. June 14thJune 28thJuly 12thJuly 26th,August 9thAugust 23rdSeptember 13thSeptember 27th9 Am -1 Pm, on Railroad Ave, in the City of Woodbury’s Parking Lot. MissionImprove public access to locally grown foods and handcrafted goods while supporting small farmers and building social connections in an all-inclusive gathering space that supports our local economy.Community Members and VisitorsJoin us at The Woodbury Farmers Market this summer starting Saturday, June 14th and ending on Saturday, September 27th. Farmers market will be open rain or shine. The location is in the parking lot along Railroad Ave off of Cooper Street past Woodbury Station Café. Click Here for map. For a full list of dates, times, and location click the vendor application link or follow us on social media FB or IG. Vendor InfoOur 2025 season vendor application is officially open! The 2025 season has new market days and will be open on the 2nd and 4th Saturday of June, July, August, and September, RAIN OR SHINE, from 9am-1pm, June 14 – September 27, 2025. The Woodbury Farm Market Committee reserves the right to review and evaluate all vendor applications. To ensure a diverse market experience, a maximum of two vendors offering similar products will be permitted each week. If vendor capacity is reached, additional applicants may be placed on a waitlist.Step 1Please read the following information to see if your business is eligible to become a vendor before taking the time to fill out the application.Farmers/Growers: You grow or raise the products you will sell at the market, including but not limited to: vegetables, fruits, herbs, nuts, flowers, plants, seafood, meats, eggs, honey, and dairy products. This can also include non-local produce. Includes vendor promotional merchandise: e.g., T-shirts, reusable bags.Value Added Foods: Processed foods, sold directly by the farmer/producer. Examples but not limited to jam, honey, salsas, dried fruits, pastas, cider, wine, beer, spirits.Food Trucks/Temporary Food Facility: Vendors who are preparing food on-site and/or sampling foods/beverages. Examples: made-to-order breakfast sandwiches, pre-made hot sandwiches, hot/iced coffee by the cup, etc. Includes vendor promotional merchandise: e.g., T-shirts, reusable bags.Non-Farm Vendors: Handmade items like soaps, candles, body scrubs etc, coffee and teas, and other handmade arts and crafts. Please note: Copyrighted materials will not be accepted. Step 2Fill out an online Vendor Application Form. Market staff will contact you within 10 business days to learn more about your business or let you know if your application has been approved.VENDOR APPLICATION FORM.This application is NOT for:Musicians: If you would like to be considered for a spot either this season or in the future, please email farmersmarket@mainstreetwoodbury.org .CSA Pick Ups: If you would like to be considered for a spot for CSA pick up, please email farmersmarket@mainstreetwoodbury.org Local Non-Profits: Registered 501(c) or 501(c)4, and Woodbury organizations may request a discounted space by emailing farmersmarket@mainstreetwoodbury.org with information about your organization. We do set aside a certain number of spaces each week for these categories, but they are first come first served and must be booked in advance.Product exclusivity is not guaranteed.Fees-Farmers Full Season – 8 Market days $279Farmers 1/2 Season – 4 Market Days $139Non-Farmers Vendors Full Season – 8 market days $ 359Non-Farmers Vendors 1/2 Season- 4 market days $ 179Half-season options include 4 consecutive market days either in early Summer (June- July Market days) or Late Summer (August- September Market days)* Full and 1/2 season vendors will be given priority for scheduling. Scheduling for individual market days will not be available until April 1st, 2025. All vendor fees are non-refundable.* Vendor payment must be submitted within 10 days of receiving an invoice. Failure to comply with this deadline may result in forfeiture of your reserved spot.Individual market day rates: $38 per market for farmers, $48 per market for non-farmers. All vendor fees are non-refundable.Vendor Payments will be collected once your application has been approved. A farm market representative will reach out to you directly. Beware of scams, do not send any payments in until a farmers market representative contacts you through the farmersmarket@mainstreetwoodbury.org email address. All vendor fees are non-refundable.Volunteers“Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world: in

Cultivating Community: where growers, makers, and creators thrive together Coles Street Market had its humble beginnings, rooted in the belief of a curated community from the start. At SocietyX, we're transforming modern living by cultivating a community from the ground up. Collaborating with local residential buildings allows us to grasp the needs and desires of our community, crafting experiences that residents desire and contributing to the growth of a vibrant and ever-evolving community dynamic.Our secret sauce lies in partnering with extraordinary makers, creatives, and growers, forming a centralized hub at Coles Park. Our curated markets go beyond offering fresh produce and artisanal goods; we carefully select dynamic vendors who share our commitment to sustainability, building relationships, and infusing joy into life’s gatherings. Join us at our weekly markets, where live music and interactive activities always enhance the experience. Together, we're redefining the essence of community at Coles Park! text_content: Hamilton Park Neighborhood Association - Farmers' Market Menu Log in Home Join Donate Sponsors Sign Up For Our Newsletter Members & Friends Committees Calendar Events Farmers' Market Become a Vendor ParkFest Movies Filming About Us Our Mission & Bylaws Board of Trustees Development Protocol Neighborhood History Developments Park Ordinance Maps FAQs 2025 Local Elections News Memorial Plaque Contact Us Remember me Forgot password Log in Home Join Donate Sponsors Sign Up For Our Newsletter Members & Friends Committees Calendar Events Farmers' Market Become a Vendor ParkFest Movies Filming About Us Our Mission & Bylaws Board of Trustees Development Protocol Neighborhood History Developments Park Ordinance Maps FAQs 2025 Local Elections News Memorial Plaque Contact Us Home Events Farmers' Market THE HPNA Farmers' Market updated 4/21/2025Vendors listed are based on 2024 participation. Wednesdays 4pm-7pm Vendors are listed by weekly participation. Weekly VendorsStony Hill Farms,our longtime and beloved farmer, will be at every market. For a link to their farm store, click here.  For their CSA options click here.  If you choose a CSA option, Stony Hill Farms is offering door to door delivery in some cases.  The drop-off must be secure (ie: a doorman who can accept packages, or package room)  Please contact Stony Hill for more information. El Chilango Taqueria  Our favorite Taco Food Truck.  Find it parked on West Hamilton near the intersection with Pavonia Avenue Pickles, Olives, Etc. formally knows as Vesco and another longtime vendor with the market joins us.  For more about this company click here. Rabble and Lion Coffee  No better way to start your day than freshly roasted coffee.  Try a cup and buy a pound.Eno Pizza  Individual Pizza's made on-site Taste of Poland, authentic Polish cuisine brought to Jersey City by two Polish immigrants. Every other week Sweet Stuff Bakery:  Homemade cookies, cake-ops, and cake by the slide LifeCap Farms:  Jersey City grown mushroomsMore vendors to come:  stay tuned. Live Music at the Farmers Market Fresh produce and fresh beats, what more could you ask for? Every Wednesday, the HPNA Farmers Market brings local flavor and local talent to Hamilton Park. Grab your groceries, stay for the music, and enjoy the rhythm of summer in the city. August 27 - Drew UhlmannSeptember 3 - Meta GirlSeptember 10 - Sean WaylandSeptember 17 - Beatles Acapella ✨ If you’re a local musician, storyteller, or performer and you're interested performing at the Farmer's Market email hpnafmkt@gmail.com. Come for the veggies, stay for the vibes! Volunteer at the Farmers MarketWant to lend a hand and support our neighborhood farmers market? We’re looking for volunteers to help with market breakdown from 7:00–8:00 PM. Tasks include taking down tents, helping vendors load up, and escorting cars out of the park.It’s a great way to give back, meet neighbors, and wrap up your evening with a dose of community spirit.Contact Us Jersey City Requirements:No outside food or eating in the market area. Please no dogs even on leash. VENDORSFor further information on how to become a vendor and/or to be put on a waitlist in the event City Rules change, please email the Farmers' Market Manager, at hpnafmkt@gmail.com How to get here via public transit:Hamilton Park is easily accessible on foot from PATH stations located at Grove Street and Newport (about a 10 minute walk from either).  Two stops along the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail (Newport and Harsimus Cove) are even closer.  We are a bike friendly neighborhood as well. Upcoming Performers at the Farmers Market Address: 344 Grove St. PMB #166, Jersey City, NJ 07302 Phone: +1 (201) 589-0750 Email: hpnajc@gmail.com Have a question? Every Saturday 9am- 3pm Come join us at the Stangl Factory for the indoor, year-round farmers’ market featuring over 30 artisanal vendors.  Enjoy the Factory’s unique atmosphere as you browse the offerings which include locally-sourced vegetables, grass-fed meats, artisan breads and cheeses, pastured eggs, specialty prepared foods and desserts. The market also has a fine selection of crafts, including handmade baskets, turned wood, soaps and bath products and hand spun yarn. Great cuisine begins with well-selected ingredients, and a sustainable lifestyle means shopping locally wherever possible. The Stangl Factory Farmers’ Market gives you a wonderful opportunity to incorporate the best of what Hunterdon County and the surrounding areas have to offer! CONNECT WITH US! Join our passionate team of volunteers, partners, donors, and sponsors. Join Us our projectsThe Tileworks CommUNITY Peace GardenThe Tileworks CommUNITY Peace GardenThe Tileworks CommUNITY Peace GardenThe Tileworks of Bucks County is a historic, working tile factory that not only produces contemporary pottery but also hosts a wide range of community events throughout the year. In 2020, the CommUNITY Peace Garden was established with the mission to use regenerative and holistic gardening practices to support the community during times of environmental challenges and food insecurity.Pebble Hill Interfaith Church GardenThe Tileworks CommUNITY Peace GardenThe Tileworks CommUNITY Peace GardenPebble Hill Interfaith Church, located in Doylestown, PA, has long been a shining example of how faith-based organizations can use their land for the broader social good of the community. For over a decade, the church has managed a large community garden, donating all its produce to the local food pantry. To support its ongoing mission of community service, The Good Folk Project is proudly leading the effort to revitalize this once vibrant garden program, continuing the church’s legacy of giving. Our goal is to build a vibrant community that supports local agriculture, small business, a healthier environment and a more sustainable future.WE HOPE YOU WILL JOIN US! ShopSupport the market and shop our T-shirts. Stocking limited quantities.Shop Market T-Shirts → VendorsFresh local produce in the heart of Princeton. To view our current list of vendors click the link below.Learn About Our Vendors → SponsorsWith our sponsors help we are able to continue to grow our market community.Learn About Our Sponsors → Donate Help us reach a larger audience and put healthy local food on peoples plates.Make a Donation → INFOPrinceton Farmers MarketHinds Plaza55 Witherspoon StreetPrinceton, NJ 08542Parking is available at the Spring Street garage right next to the marketFollow us on social media Questions? Email us!princetonfarmersmarketnj@gmail.com THE MARKET BEET Keep in touch! Sign up for our newsletter to receive weekly market updates! Email Address Sign Up Thank you for signing up for the Market Beet! As a 501(c)(3) non-profit, our mission is to create an economically sustainable community for local farmers, producers and residents. We believe in supporting local businesses and in doing so, promoting a healthier environment. When purchasing products from our market, you are not only supporting that particular farmer or vendor's business, you are also supporting local employment. In addition, you are helping protect local farmland, you are reducing the distance your food travels to the market and of course ensuring you get the freshest, most nutritious products possible. As we continue to build our community it is our goal to reach a larger audience and educate others on the value of eating fresh foods and shopping local. text_content: The Trenton Farmers Market - Over 40 different businesses located here at The Trenton Farmers Market TRENTON FARMERS MARKET 960 Spruce Street Lawrence Township, NJ 08648 609-695-2998 + Details ☰ Home About Us Farms Vendors News Contact ❮ ❯ Special hours for July 4th In observance of Independence Day we will be closing at 2PM. Trenton Farmers Market New Jersey's oldest continuously running farmers market! A farmer-owned cooperative since 1939, and located on Spruce Street in Lawrence since 1948, the Trenton Farmers Market is a beloved farmers market filled with a wide selection of Jersey Fresh fruits and vegetables, a smoke shop, Amish meats and poultry, a Polish deli, kielbasa, artisan cheese, baked goods, BBQ, rotisserie chicken, vegan selections, clothing, jewelry, handbags, home goods, essential oils, hand crafted soaps and body care, sweets, donuts, local wine, burgers and fries. You'll find a wide assortment of just about everything you need for your weekly grocery shopping right here at the Market. VENDORS WANTED Artisan makers and producers, crafters and potters looking for space to engage with shoppers should email thetfm@gmail.com, or use the form on the Contact Us page. title: West Windsor Community Farmers' Market
text_content: West Windsor Community Farmers' Market Skip to content Menu Home Visit Calendar Directions FAQs Vendors Community Groups Sponsors Become A Sponsor News About Contact FacebookTwitterInstagram Menu Home Visit Calendar Directions FAQs Vendors Community Groups Sponsors Become A Sponsor News About Contact Creating Community Through Food Since 2004 OPEN ALL YEAR! May until ThanksgivingEVERY SATURDAY 9am-1pm December through April1st & 3rd Saturdays10am-1pm Complete Market Calendar Complete Market Calendar Year-Round Location Lower Vaughn Lot at the Princeton Junction Train Station (Entrance at 877 Alexander Rd.) Google Map Directions Seriously Jersey*TM MAIN SEASON: May 3rd through November 22 from 9am-1pm Join us every single Saturday, rain or shine! *with a touch of Pennsylvania mixed in for good measure! We are an epic destination for local food. Check us out this weekend! Click on our vendors page for details on ALL of our farms and vendors! Volunteers from Yes, We CAN! are on site twice a month collecting cash donations and non-perishable foods to benefit the Arm in Arm food pantries of Princeton & Trenton. These funds are spent with our farmers keeping the commerce within our marketplace and fresh food reaching our neighbors in need. HOME GARDEN PRODUCE is accepted! Arm in Arm shelf stable requests (no glass): Maseca corn flour, Oatmeal, Grits, Cereal, 100% Fruit Juice, Canned Vegetables, Canned Beans, Canned Fruit Ongoing collections: Reusable grocery bags (Amazon, Target bags) Children's Books Clothing & Blankets We'd be honored to receive your vote as New Jersey's favorite market this year! Voting now through September 30 (please click here) We're proud to have won as NJ's favorite for 11 of the past 16 years of this national farmers market celebration.  In 2022, we ranked as NUMBER 4 IN THE NATION! New Vendor Inquiries: We welcome your inquiry for potential inclusion for the 2025 main season. Please shoot us an email to tell us your story, your connection to NJ farms, and especially why you feel what you make would be a great additon to our Market in the future (links to your social media/website are super helpful). Some considerations before reaching out: Offer value-added products that support local agriculture by incorporating locally-sourced ingredients Offer for sale culturally significant products, and/or increase the diversity of culinary cultures represented in the marketplace Offer for sale foods that are not already represented at our market (we have never offered exclusivity) Be a registered business in the state of New Jersey or Pennsylvania Produce foods in a certified inspected kitchen and/or carry a NJ/PA Cottage Foods license from the DoH Craft beverage producers may apply with special offsite event permits.  Please reach out for more information. We are not looking to add any bakers to our roster at this time. Non-Food Artisan Inquiries/"Cool-n-Airy" Makers: We host a handful of non-food artisans who MAKE and PRODUCE culinary adjacent items (ex: functional pottery, hand carved wooded spoons/utensils, quilted kitchen items, hand made cutting boards, wooden bowls, etc.) per market week with occasional special events throughout the main season. We do not host resellers, chains, importers or franchise businesses. Please inquire by sending us an email: manager@westwindsorfarmersmarket.org REVOLUTION WEST WINDSOR Learn more here about our nation's 250th in 2026 and all of the fun activities happening around town - including a logo contest! We DOUBLE SNAP! WWCFM is a proud long-time Garden State Good Food Network partner to help folks utilizing food assistance stretch their SNAP/EBT benefits further. For each $1 SNAP market token purchased, we'll match another $1 token towards the purchase of fruit and vegetables* (up to $25/market day)!! Use your Student EBT card with us as well to help stretch your family's EBT benefits. Fresh healthy food is a right, not a privilege. *use Good Food Bucks tokens for fresh fruits, vegetables, mushrooms, herb & plant seedlings More information about SNAP can be found in our FAQs. NEWS We are featured in WHYY November 14, 2023 Check out the WHYY article about your own West Windsor Farmers’ Market! Read More Farm News! August 19, 2022 Congrats to Moonshot Farm on receiving a USDA grant to convert one of their high tunnels to geothermal heat. This gives the farm the opportunity… Read More SUPPORT THE WEST WINDSOR COMMUNITY FARMERS MARKET As a grass-roots group of community organizers, in 2019 (after sixteen years), we became a registered 501(c)3 organization. From live music to cooking demos, special events, market merchandise, food insecurity outreach, and the overall market experience, we look to you, our community for your support. If you love the WWCFM as we do, please help us continue to support New Jersey farmers, artisan vendors, and create community! Consider a donation to to help us continue running our market year round. Thanks for the love! The WWCFM i

title: Highland Park Farmers Market — Main Street Highland Park
text_content: Highland Park Farmers Market — Main Street Highland Park Farmers Market About Our Vendors FAQ Events Home About Committees Welcome Arts in the Park Sponsorship Opportunities Small Business Weekend 5k Race & Spring Street Fair Vendors Latest News Historical Photos Business Support Business Directory Report a Broken Streetlight Coronavirus Resources How to: Holiday Window Signage Manual Signage/Awning Grant Performers HP Bucks: HP's Local Gift Card Menorah Lighting Planting Days Outdoor Movie Theater Townwide Garage Sale Farmers Market About Our Vendors FAQ Events Home About Committees Welcome Arts in the Park Sponsorship Opportunities Small Business Weekend 5k Race & Spring Street Fair Vendors Latest News Historical Photos Business Support Business Directory Report a Broken Streetlight Coronavirus Resources How to: Holiday Window Signage Manual Signage/Awning Grant Performers HP Bucks: HP's Local Gift Card Menorah Lighting Planting Days Outdoor Movie Theater Townwide Garage Sale Every Friday, February 21 - December 12, 2025February & March hours: 11 am - 4 pmApril, May, June, July, August, September, October hours: 11 am - 5 pmNovember & December hours: 11 am - 4 pmSNAP/EBT Welcome, Good Food Bucks Program Partner Stay in the Loop with the HPFM Newsletter About UsLocated right off Main Street (Rt. 27), the Highland Park Farmers Market was established in 1996 and continues to operate as a weekly open-air farmers market. Farmers and other producers from throughout NJ come every Friday from February through December to sell some of the finest local and homemade products the state has to offer. From Jersey Fresh and seasonal produce, to specialty mushrooms, farm-fresh dairy, sustainably-caught fish, homemade breads, pastries, pickles, and hot sauce, and so much more, the Highland Park Farmers Market has everything you need to cross off your grocery list while supporting local farmers and small businesses. Check out our list of vendors here!In addition to our wonderful vendors, the Market is frequently joined by community partners such as the Global Grace Be The Change Health Van, the Highland Park Public Library, Sustainable Highland Park, and other local businesses and organizations. Food trucks and tables provide a place to enjoy your lunch break and meet up with friends and neighbors. The Market also hosts special events such as cooking competitions with seasonal ingredients, craft and theme days, and our live music series #MusicAtTheMarketHP, which brings local musicians to perform. See our full list of special events for the season here! Come by the Market to support local, farm-fresh food and say hello! Market Tokens and VouchersWhile you can always use cash at the Market — and most of our vendors accept credit/debit cards — there are a number of other ways to pay. Check out the list below or visit the Market staff under the Susie Welkovits Pavilion to learn more. Market Bucks These black tokens can be used like cash at all vendors and do not expire. They can be purchased from Market staff under the Welkovits Pavilion using debit/credit cards or Google/Apple Pay. HP Bucks These digital gift cards can be used at businesses throughout Highland Park, including the Market. To redeem your gift card for Market Bucks, please visit Market staff under the Welkovits Pavilion. SNAP/EBT We are a SNAP-Authorized Farmers Market, which means that you can use your SNAP EBT/NJ Families First card on eligible food products at the Market.To use your SNAP EBT card at the Market, visit the Market staff under the Welkovits Pavilion. They will process your transaction and provide you with red SNAP tokens that can be spent at the Market. These red tokens can be used to buy any SNAP-eligible items within the Market. While most vendors have SNAP-eligible items available, the tokens must be purchased from Market staff under the Pavilion. These tokens expire at the end of December each year.For more information about eligible items, visit the USDA info page here. Good Food Bucks The Good Food Buck Program (funded by City Green, Inc.) aims to increase access to locally-grown produce. When you spend your SNAP/EBT benefits at the HPFM, you can receive up to $25 per week of Good Food Bucks for free. For every $1 of SNAP funds spent, you will receive an additional $1 of Good Food Bucks (up to $25 per week).When you make a transaction using a SNAP/EBT card with the Market staff under the Pavilion, you will receive these Good Food Buck green tokens. These green tokens can be spent on fresh fruits, vegetables, and herbs at the Market. Like SNAP/EBT tokens, Good Food Bucks tokens expire at the end of December each year.To learn more about the Good Food Buck Program, visit their website here. HPFM Community Food Pantry Vouchers These $5 vouchers are distributed by the Highland Park Community Food Pantry beginning in July of each year. These vouchers may be used to purchase groceries throughout the Market. Vouchers expire at the end of the Mark

title: HEAR HERE, LLC
text_content: HEAR HERE, LLC Skip to Content Open Menu Close Menu HEAR HERE, LLC Home Vendor Applications Vendor Set up & FAQ About Me Blog Vendor Insider Club NOT A SCAM Login Account 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu HEAR HERE, LLC Home Vendor Applications Vendor Set up & FAQ About Me Blog Vendor Insider Club NOT A SCAM Login Account 0 0 Home Vendor Applications Vendor Set up & FAQ About Me Blog Vendor Insider Club NOT A SCAM Login Account Thoughtfully curating events that shape and enrich communities throughout New Jersey. Contact me now! Jennifer Perkel, Founder and creative curator of Hear Here, LLC.A pop up market organizer, farmers market manager, vendor and Cottage Permit holder. Vendor Applications Here Upcoming Events The Power of a Farmers Market in Your CommunityA small farmers market can bring big benefits to a town. It’s more than just a place to shop—it’s a vibrant gathering space that strengthens community bonds, supports local farmers and artisans, and promotes healthy living. By creating a space where neighbors can connect and discover fresh, locally grown produce and handmade goods, a farmers market fosters a sense of pride and belonging. Beyond community connections, it also boosts the local economy, drawing visitors and supporting small businesses. Whether it’s sparking conversations, fueling local commerce, or making fresh food accessible, a farmers market is a powerful tool for creating a thriving, connected, and sustainable town. Want to learn more about our event planning and community enrichment event services? CLICK HERE All about the current Farmers Markets Atlantic Highlands Farmers Market Join us every Friday from 10 AM to 3 PM at 111 First Avenue, for the Atlantic Highlands Farmers Market! This market is nestled in the heart of a walkable neighborhood. Shop fresh produce, sweet and savory baked goods, pickles and olives, local honey, hot sauces, sourdough breads, prepared foods, handmade crafts, and more while supporting local vendors. Hazlet Farmers Market Visit us every Saturday from 10 AM to 2 PM at 1776 Union Avenue, Hazlet! The market is located in the Town Hall and Swim Club’s complex. Explore a wide selection of fresh produce, pickles and olives, fresh sourdough breads, local honey, baked goods, handmade crafts, and more while supporting local businesses. Howell FarmersMarket Join us every Sunday from 10 AM to 2 PM at Echo Lake Park in Howell! You’ll find local wildlife right along side of a bustling market. Shop fresh produce, sweet and savory baked goods, fresh cut flowers, locally baked sourdough foods, handmade crafts, and more while shopping with small, local businesses. What people are saying about Hear Here Jenn was both kind and professional. She cares about her vendors as people, and it shows in her email communications before the event and in her attention to detail the day of the event. I made my sales minimum and had a great time doing it. I highly recommend her as an organizer.- SherylReview for : Edison Sunday Markets Nicely organized events!- JanReview for : MAKER/CRAFTER VENDOR DATABASE The show was run very well and was organized. Jen was very responsive and helpful, I look forward to doing more events that she runs. - MorganReview for : Edison Sunday Markets Amazing time! So grateful to be a part of this experience. I met some fantastic people and what a great location. - VanessaReview for : Self Care and Retail Therapy Saturday at Colonial Nursery, Lincroft, NJ Press Releases 〰️ Press Releases 〰️ Press Releases 〰️ The Howell Farmers Market by Hear Here is a Perennial Favorite! https://issuu.com/micromediapubs/docs/2025-08-09_-_the_howell_times Hear Here, LLC to Manage 2025 Parsippany Farmers Market Season https://parsippanyfocus.com/2025/04/10/hear-here-llc-to-manage-2025-parsippany-farmers-market-season/ via @Parsippany Focus Hear Here, LLC to Organize Hazlet Farmers Market this Seasonhttps://patch.com/new-jersey/holmdel-hazlet/new-farmers-market-coming-hazlet?utm_source=share-link&utm_medium=web&utm_campaign=share Proudly supporting small businesses with the “Jersey Shops” Initiative. title: FRESH Markets - Pop Up Shopping For Local Communities
text_content: FRESH Markets - Pop Up Shopping For Local Communities FRESH markets APPLY NOW Open main menu Home Locations Upcoming Events Sell About Support Vendor Login Pop-Up Shopping For Local Communities Shop & Sell year round at New Jersey's largest and most diverse group of farmers & makers markets. Apply To Sell Upcoming Events Our Partners: Previous Next Empowering Makers For more than 13 years, we’ve connected farmers, makers, and food purveyors with local communities through hundreds of carefully curated pop-up events and farmers markets annually. We make it easy for local businesses to connect with their community, offering a platform to showcase handmade goods, build relationships, and grow. Whether you're starting a new venture or expanding a familiar one, Fresh Markets provides the tools to help you succeed right where it matters — at home. text_content: HEAR HERE, LLC Skip to Content Open Menu Close Menu HEAR HERE, LLC Home Vendor Applications Vendor Set up & FAQ About Me Blog Vendor Insider Club NOT A SCAM Login Account 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu HEAR HERE, LLC Home Vendor Applications Vendor Set up & FAQ About Me Blog Vendor Insider Club NOT A SCAM Login Account 0 0 Home Vendor Applications Vendor Set up & FAQ About Me Blog Vendor Insider Club NOT A SCAM Login Account Thoughtfully curating events that shape and enrich communities throughout New Jersey. Contact me now! Jennifer Perkel, Founder and creative curator of Hear Here, LLC.A pop up market organizer, farmers market manager, vendor and Cottage Permit holder. Vendor Applications Here Upcoming Events The Power of a Farmers Market in Your CommunityA small farmers market can bring big benefits to a town. It’s more than just a place to shop—it’s a vibrant gathering space that strengthens community bonds, supports local farmers and artisans, and promotes healthy living. By creating a space where neighbors can connect and discover fresh, locally grown produce and handmade goods, a farmers market fosters a sense of pride and belonging. Beyond community connections, it also boosts the local economy, drawing visitors and supporting small businesses. Whether it’s sparking conversations, fueling local commerce, or making fresh food accessible, a farmers market is a powerful tool for creating a thriving, connected, and sustainable town. Want to learn more about our event planning and community enrichment event services? CLICK HERE All about the current Farmers Markets Atlantic Highlands Farmers Market Join us every Friday from 10 AM to 3 PM at 111 First Avenue, for the Atlantic Highlands Farmers Market! This market is nestled in the heart of a walkable neighborhood. Shop fresh produce, sweet and savory baked goods, pickles and olives, local honey, hot sauces, sourdough breads, prepared foods, handmade crafts, and more while supporting local vendors. Hazlet Farmers Market Visit us every Saturday from 10 AM to 2 PM at 1776 Union Avenue, Hazlet! The market is located in the Town Hall and Swim Club’s complex. Explore a wide selection of fresh produce, pickles and olives, fresh sourdough breads, local honey, baked goods, handmade crafts, and more while supporting local businesses. Howell FarmersMarket Join us every Sunday from 10 AM to 2 PM at Echo Lake Park in Howell! You’ll find local wildlife right along side of a bustling market. Shop fresh produce, sweet and savory baked goods, fresh cut flowers, locally baked sourdough foods, handmade crafts, and more while shopping with small, local businesses. Contact me now! Jennifer Perkel, Founder and creative curator of Hear Here, LLC.A pop up market organizer, farmers market manager, vendor and Cottage Permit holder. Vendor Applications Here Upcoming Events The Power of a Farmers Market in Your CommunityA small farmers market can bring big benefits to a town. It’s more than just a place to shop—it’s a vibrant gathering space that strengthens community bonds, supports local farmers and artisans, and promotes healthy living. By creating a space where neighbors can connect and discover fresh, locally grown produce and handmade goods, a farmers market fosters a sense of pride and belonging. Beyond community connections, it also boosts the local economy, drawing visitors and supporting small businesses. Whether it’s sparking conversations, fueling local commerce, or making fresh food accessible, a farmers market is a powerful tool for creating a thriving, connected, and sustainable town. Want to learn more about our event planning and community enrichment event services? CLICK HERE All about the current Farmers Markets Atlantic Highlands Farmers Market Join us every Friday from 10 AM to 3 PM at 111 First Avenue, for the Atlantic Highlands Farmers Market! This market is nestled in the heart of a walkable neighborhood. Shop fresh produce, sweet and savory baked goods, pickles and olives, local honey, hot sauces, sourdough breads, prepared foods, handmade crafts, and more while supporting local vendors. Hazlet Farmers Market Visit us every Saturday from 10 AM to 2 PM at 1776 Union Avenue, Hazlet! The market is located in the Town Hall and Swim Club’s complex. Explore a wide selection of fresh produce, pickles and olives, fresh sourdough breads, local honey, baked goods, handmade crafts, and more while supporting local businesses. Howell FarmersMarket Join us every Sunday from 10 AM to 2 PM at Echo Lake Park in Howell! You’ll find local wildlife right along side of a bustling market. Shop fresh produce, sweet and savory baked goods, fresh cut flowers, locally baked sourdough foods, handmade crafts, and more while shopping with small, local businesses. She cares about her vendors as people, and it shows in her email communications before the event and in her attention to detail the day of the event. text_content: FRESH Markets - Pop Up Shopping For Local Communities FRESH markets APPLY NOW Open main menu Home Locations Upcoming Events Sell About Support Vendor Login Pop-Up Shopping For Local Communities Shop & Sell year round at New Jersey's largest and most diverse group of farmers & makers markets. Apply To Sell Upcoming Events Our Partners: Previous Next Empowering Makers For more than 13 years, we’ve connected farmers, makers, and food purveyors with local communities through hundreds of carefully curated pop-up events and farmers markets annually. We make it easy for local businesses to connect with their community, offering a platform to showcase handmade goods, build relationships, and grow. Whether you're starting a new venture or expanding a familiar one, Fresh Markets provides the tools to help you succeed right where it matters — at home. Transforming Communities 13+ Years of Supporting Local Entrepreneurship Over the years, we've learned what it takes to curate successful markets that bring farmers, makers, and communities together. Platform for Your Small Business To Grow We create a space for small businesses to grow, showcase their products and connecting with loyal customers. Connecting Vendors with Community Our markets bring together local makers, small businesses, and residents, creating a welcoming space where connections flourish and community spirit grows. 8,689 vendorsin our community 185 eventshosted this past year 44,886 bookingssince 2016 Locations See where we're popping up across Monmouth & Ocean Counties. 2025 Holland Ridge Farms Fall Flower Festival Sep 13, 2025 - Oct 12, 2025 Join us at Holland Ridge Farms for their 8th Annual U Pick Sunflower Fall Flower Festival Located in Cream Ridge, New Jersey, @hollandridgefarms is a remarkable 300+ acre flower farm situated just ... text_content: Downtown Clifton, New Jersey top of pageDowntown Clifton, NJ 973-557-3886 HomeOur BusinessesEventsContactMoreUse tab to navigate through the menu items.Downtown Clifton, New Jersey Downtown Clifton, NJ is defined as Main Avenue from the City of Passaic to the Route 46 overpass and at Clifton Avenue from First Street to Lexington Avenue. Approximately 250 businesses call Downtown Clifton home. The Downtown Clifton "Special Improvement District" (SID) is run by the Downtown Clifton Economic Development Group, Inc. that represents the business community and serves as a voice to City Hall and other agencies responsible for serving the Downtown community. ​ This website serves as a directory for the businesses in the district. title: West Milford Farmer's Market
text_content: West Milford Farmer's Market Home 2025 Vendors Events Calendar Market News Music LineUp Become a Vendor New Vendor Contact Form Download Registration Forms 2024 Vendor Payment Newsletter signup Contact Us 2024 WINTER Vendors Home 2025 Vendors Events Calendar Market News Music LineUp Become a Vendor New Vendor Contact Form Download Registration Forms 2024 Vendor Payment Newsletter signup Contact Us 2024 WINTER Vendors Home 🌱OPENING DAY🌱Wednesday June 4th 20253-7pmWelcome to the West Milford Farmer’s Market!Summer Season Market runs from 3pm-7pm June through October - Outdoors in the Parking Lot Location: Presbyterian Church at 1452 Union Valley Rd, West Milford, NJ 07480We are SO excited for our 2025 season and promise to bring you the fresh, local food from the best local farmers, producers, and artisans in our community. Follow our Facebook page for the latest updates. Or sign up for our newsletter to get weekly updates on what’s happening at the market. Newsletter Sign UpFor Email Newsletters you can trust. We are Back!!! Get ready to find all of your favorites from pickles to baked goods and vegetables during the summer months OUTDOORS. Every Wednesday from 3p-7p June through October 2025.Opening Day is Wednesday June 4th - Come Join Us! Fuzzy friends ON LEASH and good behavior are welcome. PLEASE use THE SURROUNDING AREAS to relax WITH YOUR PET. please be sure to clean up after them before you leave the market! 🐶🐶🐶 VOLUNTEERS NEEDEDIf you have an hour or more on Wednesday afternoons this summer, we could use your help with set up and/or breakdown of the market. Setting up and breaking down the market takes ½ - 1 hour before and after the market. We could use the help between 1:30-2:30pm or from 6:30-7:30pm on any Wednesday between June 1st and October 12th. Can be used for community service hours for church or school.We would greatly appreciate any and all help. Please submit this form or stop by the Market tent. Name * First Name Last Name Email Address * Message * Thank you! Like us on Instagram & find us on Facebook: The West Milford Farmer’s Market#foodfarmsfriends Learn more Market Mission:The West Milford Farmers' Market is brought to you by: Nature Connection of West Milford, a 501(c)3 non-profit organization dedicated to promoting .The West Milford Farmers Market looks to nourish our residents by creating a ‘one-stop’ opportunity for regional shoppers to conveniently obtain and sell high quality locally grown and crafted products in a welcoming, informative and entertaining setting. The West Milford Farmers Market will seek to be creative and innovative, but will at all times be guided by the following core principles:All products available at the market will be high quality and produced and/or crafted by the vendors themselves in order to maximize the economic, environmental and social benefit of the Market to the local community.West Milford vendors will be prioritized for available vendor spaces as they become available, but vendors outside the municipal boundary within a 75 mile radius of the Town will be permitted in the interest of providing a diversity of foodstuffs and goods to regional shoppers.The Market will serve as a community social resource, by providing opportunities for enhanced social interaction through regular entertainment and educational programs; e.g., performances by local musicians, and free tabling space for local non-profit, non-partisan entities.

title: Welcome to the Scotch Plains Farmers Market
text_content: Welcome to the Scotch Plains Farmers Market 430 Park Avenue • (Municipal Parking Lot) • Scotch Plains, New Jersey 07076 Home Directions / Contact Welcome to the Scotch Plains Farmers' Market. We are one of the most popular Farmers' Market around - celebrating 33 years of Jersey Fresh and local - with a full roster of the "Best of the Best" Vendors. Our Market offers a large, safe, and enjoyable walking Market for our guests. Our Market is open every Saturday, from 8 am - 1 pm, rain or shine. The season runs through the last Saturday, before Thanksgiving. Join us for a great experience. In the meantime, please visit our Facebook Page - where all information and updates can be found. Thank you. HISTORY The Marketplace was originally established in 1992 as a community service to help support local farmers, and enable them to develop new markets for their fresh grown produce. In 1994, the Scotch Plains Business + Professional Association (SPBPA) took over the management reign as a means to attract and increase business activity in the downtown Scotch Plains Towne Centre. Over the years, it has evolved, and expanded into a diverse Marketplace. The Scotch Plains Farmers' Marketplace is proudly managed by the Scotch Plains Business+ Professional Association - a not-for-profit organization - whose purpose is to assist and enhance the business community, in the Township of Scotch Plains, as well as its community involvement, and contributions as well. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION WIC Coupons are welcomed by participating vendors at the Marketplace. The Scotch Plains Farmers' Marketplace is managed by the Scotch Plains Business & Professional Association. SPBPA is a non-profit organization whose purpose is to assist and enhance the business community in the Township of Scotch Plains through its networking activities and community involvement.

PROGRAM Celebrating 14 Years of Fresh Food! The G.I.F.T. Program continues its mission to provide nutritious food to those in need. With over 13,000 pounds of donations collected last year, the program makes a real difference in the lives of local families. The Summit Farmers Market community plays a vital role in this success, with customers and vendors generously contributing to the cause. G.R.A.C.E. (Giving and Receiving Assistance for our Community’s Essentials) partners with the G.I.F.T. Program to ensure these donations reach families on a weekly basis. To learn more about this community program and/or sign up to volunteer, click on tab below. VOLUNTEER NOW SUMMIT BUSINESSES & NONPROFITS SIGN UP SDI reserves one free spaces at the Market for downtown businesses and/or Summit based nonprofits to promote themselves. Any downtown business located in the Special Improvement District (CRBD and SID districts) of Summit and any Summit-based Nonprofit Organization may sign up to participate for free. Summit Downtown, Inc. has the right to refuse any request that does not meet the criteria.Sign-up Information: Sign up is online and requires your name and business name and what you intend to do/sell during your participation at the Market. Please list the name of the person who will represent your business at the Market along with their contact information. Each business MUST sign up themselves and complete the form with the required information listed below. You will be required to provide a COI (Certificate of Insurance) naming the City and Summit Downtown as additionally insured (a sample can be provided) and sign/date a Hold Harmless document. if your business involves food additional Summit Board of Health forms will be required to be completed. Each Summit business or nonprofit may sign up for a maximum of two Sundays during a season.If Sundays are not filled, a business/nonprofit may sign up for an additional Sunday at $100 per week.Businesses will be allowed to sell their product(s), demonstrate their product(s) or distribute information about their product line.Nonprofits WILL NOT be permitted to fundraise, exchange money or petition for signatures or endorsements or sell wares or food. title: The Market at Union
text_content: The Market at Union Top Home Market Vendors Welcome Become a Vendor The Market at Union Home Market Vendors Welcome Become a Vendor Previously known as the Union Farmers Market, The Market at Union has been rebranded and relocated to the front parking lot of Town Hall/Union Public Library, 1980 Morris Avenue. The Market at Union will continue its commitment to being a vibrant hub for local farmers, producers, artisans, and crafters.Originally established as the Union Farmers Market in June 2015, our mission has always been to provide a space where community members can come together to support local agriculture and craftsmanship.At The Market at Union, we are dedicated to promoting the benefits of buying fresh and eating local. By showcasing a diverse array of nutritious food choices and unique handmade goods, we encourage residents to make informed dietary decisions while strengthening the local economy. Join us as we celebrate our community’s bounty and foster a healthier, more connected Union.Phone Number       908.851.8500Location Town Hall/Union Public Library - 1980 Morris Avenue2025 Market Season Begins Thursday, June 5th! 2025 Market VendorsAll current market vendors are listed alphabetically. LOCAL FARMERs WAGNER FAMILY FARMAlways an avid gardener, Chris Wagner spent years expanding a small plot in the family's suburban home. Each year, the yield of fruits and vegetables grew & recipes for sauce, jellies, and more were perfected. In 2021, the time was finally right to transition from gardener to farmer, and Wagner Family Farms was born. HAWK RIDGE FARMThis Organic Farm follows organic and regenerative farming practices, growing a variety of fruits and vegetables. In addition to producing, they keep pastured raised chickens for eggs, a small herd of rescue animals, honey bees for pollination and honey production, and gourmet mushrooms. BIG JOHN’S GOURMET BURGERSSpecializes in delicious burgers, hotdogs and fried chicken sandwiches, and Turkey Meatball sandwiches. THE BOX TACOS & SANGUICHESThis food truck offers Argentine & Latin American-inspired eats with a rotating menu. CAT LIKE REFLEXESThis truck offers American Cuisine that specialized on empanadas, cheesesteaks, sliders and tornado fries. EAT MY FRANKS Your to-go destination featuring gourmet beef and vegan hot dogs, fancy franks with delicious toppings and the Chicago Hot Dog. E.S.F. LIFESTYLEOffers a variety of all-natural holistic products including Irish Sea Moss, Elderberry Syrup, and an assortment of Herbal Teas all hand made. Health is wealth! GRANDMA EMMA’SA Southern staple that makes for the perfect ending to any meal, or just comfort for the soul. 100% vegan, but made for everyone to love. GREY’S AREA GRILLEFeaturing seared salmon, grilled bbq, vegan black bean dream pita, smoked beef brisket, and raspberry tea. JAMMED UP BAKERYA cookie centric bakery, from the people at Van Gogh's Ear Cafe. They specialize in cookies, brownies, cupcakes, decorated cookies, home made bread and special order cakes. KRISSY’S KAKESSpecializes in cakes jars with an array of flavors from tres leches, red velvet, chocolate obsession, funfetti with vanilla frosting, and much more. LATIN BITESA fusion of Cuban & Puerto Rican appetizers & entrees, Latin Bites dug into their roots to bring you an exceptional experience. LOVE4NUTSNJYou’ll fall in love with this nut vendors as they bring crunchy healthy tempting pistachios, walnuts, peanuts, etc. LOVEFOODMOREThis husband and wife chef team create custom fresh and homemade dishes. NITJUAN DESIGNS You’ll feel the positive energy as you walk to this vendor to check out her elegant handcrafted wearable art featuring gemstones, crystals, glass, metal, and many other materials TENMOMIGet ready for a hand-crafted, chef-inspired ramen experience.
